subject: Business
title: Scenario Planning Before the Table
description: A fast breakdown of Scenario Planning Before the Table for builders.

hook.text: The other side rejects your first offer. Now what? If you didn't plan for this, you're improvising.

buildup.text: Scenario planning means mapping out multiple paths: best case, worst case, and likely case.

discovery.text: For each scenario, prepare a response, a concession you can trade, and a redirection.

twist.text: The other side has prepared too. If their moves surprise you, your preparation was too narrow.

climax.text: Chess grandmasters think five moves ahead. Top negotiators prepare at least three paths forward.

punchline.text: Don't plan your script. Plan your decision tree.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of scenario planning in negotiation?
options: Preparing multiple response paths for different outcomes
Predicting exactly what the other side will say
Writing a script to follow word-for-word
